attributes.action: Give some leway on taking just water to school
attributes.additional_details:
Children should be able to take flavoured still water or sugar free dilute juice.
I wouldn't rather a child drink throughout the day then have a child dehydrated in hospital. Schools can not force a child to drink water if they don't like it.
Having a drink is a human right!
attributes.background: I understand there is a policy in schools to only take water for children to drink through the day. I think there should be some leway on this as not all children like water and on hot days their not drinking enough.

rejection.details:
Petitions must call for a specific action that the UK Government or House of Commons is responsible for.

Decisions about what drinks children can take to school are a matter for individual schools, not the Government or House of Commons.

As a result it is not possible for the Government or House of Commons to take the action you have requested.
